children.subject: Is 61BL taking steps to expand? There are 80 or so students on the waitlist.
There's not much info on the Summer 2019 website
They are currently updating the summer website for CS61BL..but you can view their website for a previous semester. That should give you a good idea about deadlines and what fast-paced the class is.

history.content:
Hi Anon Comp,

I am also enrolled in CS 61BL for the summer and I think we share the same worries about how hard this course might be considering that I need an A to declare and this pandemic situation has caused inconvenient GPA calculation. Someone else might answer your question better, but here is what I found on the Berkeley Reddit page from a former 61BL TA. Source: https://www.reddit.com/r/berkeley/comments/g2b9em/cs_61bl_vs_61b_in_fall_with_hug/

"Think there are plenty of reasons to decide either way, but can provide some perspective on the summer. The instructors are veteran TAs who have taught the class for years, and we are 100% dedicated to making this summer the best learning experience as we possibly can. Historically people have really enjoyed 61BL because of the lab based format. Essentially you will be doing a lot of learning by doing, which will entail implementing data structures, algorithms, etc nearly every day in lab after you have learned about them. We like to think that you will come out of 61BL an even stronger programmer than if you had taken 61B because you will be writing much more code (25-30 labs + 4 projects). There is also the benefit of taking a single class over the summer where you will be able to focus much more of your energy on learning and doing well in the class. We would absolutely love to have as many students take 61BL this summer because think this is going to be the best offering of 61BL ever, but we can understand if you would want to wait to take the class with Hug."

children.subject:
Again, I am taking 61BL with you, so I really have no idea how it's going to go compared to a regular semester...

You can check on previous semesters or 61B and 61BL websites for the grading policies and compare if you're curious. My motivation to take 61BL over 61B was so I can declare earlier and also I strongly believe that I am a better learner through project based learning and coding everyday. So the difficulty of the exam doesn't matter for me as long as I feel comfortable with the learning experience. But please also know that this semester grading may be different due to the COVID-19 making classes online. There is still no update from the staff about grading policy changes.

Other than that, please think wisely on what experience you want. It's normal to stress about how grading works if you are in L&S (I do too), but remember in the end, data structures and algorithms come up again and again in upper divs and interview questions.

Absolutely! This makes a lot of sense. Another apprehension I had was working on stuff alone. I have heard it really helps to have a couple of people to work with, especially on the projects. But I don't know how they are going to facilitate that in an online format. I have heard 61B projects are insanely hard and working on them alone will be tough to say the least.

Very true. Again, COVID-19 messes up a lot of logistics. For instance, how are we going to deal with lab/project partners over multiple time zones? I'd stay patient and focus on your finals for now. The TAs are busy enough right now handling exams and grading and there is still over a month left until Session C starts. I plan to email to the 61BL staff about these questions after the academic semester is done (you should too).

@anon. Scale in the students' response 

Thanks for sharing this! Do you have much idea about how the grading is going to be like as compared to a regular semester? It is tougher/easier to score? I have also heard a lot about Hug and don't want to miss out on the experience but I have also heard his exams are super hard.

history.content:
<md>I am enrolled in CS61BL this summer and am seriously considering taking it. But I couldn't find much information about how it compares with the semester-long version of the class (61B). Could someone who has taken the class/knows about how it works generally give their feedback about this class? I understand it is 2x the regular semester speed and it's already super fast during the semester. So, does it become REALLY tough? What about grading? Is it tougher/easier to score over the summer?

Thank you!</md>
history.subject: Thought on 61BL
